intro: Grisebachia solivaga, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Grisebachia solivaga thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is typically found at high elevations, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
